summary: This document is a second amended complaint filed by the United States of America against Jeffrey E. Epstein and several other defendants regarding their unlawful occupancy of a property that is under the jurisdiction of the Office of Foreign Missions on behalf of Iran. The complaint outlines various claims including ejectment, unjust enrichment, and breach of contract, asserting that the defendants have failed to vacate the premises and have unlawfully benefited from it.

persons.name: Mary Jo White
persons.context: Mary Jo White is the attorney representing the United States in this case, filing the second amended complaint.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is named as a defendant for unlawfully occupying the premises and failing to surrender possession to the Government.

persons.name: Ivan S. Fisher
persons.context: Fisher is named as a defendant for being an unapproved subtenant of the premises and failing to vacate.

persons.name: Ellyn Bank
persons.context: Bank is named as a defendant for being an unapproved occupant of the premises.

connections.description: Epstein entered into an unapproved sublease with Fisher for the premises, which led to both being named as defendants.
Fisher has permitted Bank to occupy the premises without government approval.
Fisher has permitted Cohen to occupy the premises without government approval.
Fisher has permitted Diane Fisher to occupy the premises without government approval.
Fisher has permitted Gerzog to occupy the premises without government approval.
Fisher has permitted Heilbrun to occupy the premises without government approval.
Fisher has permitted McDermott to occupy the premises without government approval.
Fisher has permitted Martin to occupy the premises without government approval.
Fisher has permitted Siegel to occupy the premises without government approval.
Fisher has permitted Soffer to occupy the premises without government approval.
Fisher has permitted Talsig to occupy the premises without government approval.

events.title: Lease Agreement Signed
events.description: Epstein entered into a lease agreement with the Office of Foreign Missions for the premises.

events.title: Abandonment of Premises
events.description: Epstein abandoned personal occupancy of the premises required by the lease agreement.

events.title: Request to Sublet
events.description: Epstein informed the Government of his wish to sublet the premises to Fisher.

events.title: Denial of Sublease
events.description: The Government informed Epstein that it would not approve the sublease to Fisher.

events.title: Termination Notice Issued
events.description: The Government notified Epstein that the lease would be terminated due to his failure to cure the default.

locations: 34 East 69th Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: The United States Government is seeking possession of the premises located at 34 East 69th Street, New York, New York, which is under the jurisdiction of the Office of Foreign Missions on behalf of Iran.
Epstein and Fisher unlawfully occupied the premises without government approval.
The lease agreement between Epstein and the Government was terminated due to Epstein's failure to occupy the premises personally.
Fisher was found to be occupying the premises despite not being an approved subtenant.
The Government has filed multiple claims against Epstein and Fisher, including ejectment and unjust enrichment.
